pros: Loved working at the help desk, the staff and management were amazing. The workload was also very low if you worked during non-peak hours.
cons: None really, other than the fact that this is just a student job that doesn't really lead to anything.

review_title: students are good, lack of leadership from top down
pros: Students are great and diversity is good
cons: a lot of employees that only walk around. don't know what their jobs were but you see the same people just walking around day after day. lack of leadership and accountability from top down

review_title: Nice Place, Nice People, Poor Pay
pros: Very nice environment, people are receptive and generally helpful.
cons: Very poor salary ranges. Current NY retirement tiers are not what they were.

review_title: Great Work Environment... Changes Could Be Made
job_title: Student Success Advisor in Queensbury, NY
cons: Seems like there is not a lot of efficiency and everyone just figures out what to do in the moment

pros: Never loste sight of the customer
cons: Giving credit to people doing the work.

pros: Student focused, great people, beautiful campus environment
cons: Pandemic is challenging all of higher education

pros: They pay on time at least but that’s it
cons: They will dock you for anything

review_title: Administrative nightmare, bloated lazy fat cats running an institution that has a lot of potential.
pros: Plenty of opportunity for growth, friendly staff, and beautiful location.
cons: Misappropriation of funds seems pervasive and the "International Study" program is a glorified vacation for faculty using college funds.  Institution is lax on policy, so what could be the policy one day could change the next day without any written notification.  Confidentiality is lacking and faculty and staff constantly interact with students in an inappropriate fashion, example; staff or faculty dating students.

pros: The overall mission to provide college education to students from all backgrounds and incomes is a good one; employees are hard-working and qualified; two strong employee unions work, for the most part, well with administration; there is a sense that one is working alongside colleagues toward a common goal and for a common good.
cons: There is an over-reliance on part-time labor. Budgets are cut for teaching and student services but increased for administration.

pros: Great people to work with and awesome location. Students are fairly decent as well . Close to many vacation spots in the area.
cons: There administrative staff in many cases has no clue. There are no set policies and procedure. When there are they are not followed any way . They do not follow New York State law they follow there own often.

pros: Collegial work environment. Progressive leadership (current President is Kristine Duffy). Great student body.  Renovating a number of facilities. SUNY Adirondack makes a difference in its community, and it's fun to be a part of.
cons: Salary structure is below the Capitol Region, but it is a lower cost of living in the beautiful foothills of the Adirondacks.

pros: The college is in a lot of transition and they are striving to improve services for students and staff to be successful.
cons: There can be a lot of politics to navigate when handling an issue as a student and a staff member working on the issue.

pros: Great colleagues and students. I enjoyed teaching there.
cons: Unfortunately, I found that no matter how much they liked me, they wouldn't hire anyone full time without a PhD, which is a shame. I wish they would hire based on experience, loyalty, and student satisfaction.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Queensbury, NY
pros: Great work environment and competitive pay.
cons: Small department with not much room for advancement.
